problem_text:
Suppose that G is a finitely generated metabelian group all of whose integral homology groups are finitely generated. Is it true that G is a group of finite rank? The answer is affirmative if G splits over the derived subgroup (J. R. J. Groves, Quart. J. Math., 33, no. 132 (1982), 405–420).
G. A. Noskov
answer: Yes, it is (D. H. Kochloukova, Groups St. Andrews 2001 in Oxford, Vol. II, Cambridge Univ. Press, 2003, 332–343).
